title: Test Bear Portrait
description: A test of the ArtBot multi-agent system
prompt:
"Create a formal portrait of a distinguished bear wearing a bowler hat, in the distinctive style of Ren√© Magritte. The composition should be centered and framed for use as a profile picture.

Painting Style:
- Smooth, matte finish with subtle visible brushwork in flat color areas
- Soft, precise edges with careful gradients reminiscent of Belgian skies
- Oil painting technique with minimal texture and impasto
- Deliberate, controlled paint application with unmodulated color fields

Bear Portrait Elements:
- Regal, anthropomorphized bear with distinguished facial features
- Formal portrait composition with the bear's head and shoulders centered
- Bowler hat as the sole human attire, creating a surreal juxtaposition
- Clean, precise lines and shapes with subtle tonal transitions
- Careful attention to light and shadow, with a slightly dramatic lighting
- Neutral, simplified background to emphasize the bear's presence

Maintain Magritte's distinctive painting style, with a surreal and thought-provoking quality, while ensuring the portrait is perfectly centered and suitable for use as a profile picture."

character.name: Reginald P. Grizzlington, Esq.
character.title: The Distinguished Ursine
character.backstory: Descended from a long line of ursine intellectuals, Sir Reginald Bruinsworth inherited his distinguished bearing and sartorial flair from noble ancestors who eschewed the wilderness for a life of scholarly pursuits. His seminal treatise on apian metaphysics, "The Bees' Knees: An Inquiry into the Existential Ennui of Melittology," cemented his reputation as a leading thinker, while his signature bowler hat served as a whimsical acknowledgment that one cannot escape one's essential ursine nature, no matter how erudite the veneer.
